citations.narrative:
Six young guinea pigs housed in the indoor area had no water available, and when offered water all animals drank
immediately for several minutes. A second water bowl was placed in the enclosure and all the guinea pigs continued to
drink for over ten minutes while inspectors observed. The employee stated that water was last offered to the animals the
night before.
The reactions of these animals clearly show that they were suffering from a lack of water and had been deprived of
drinking water for too long a period of time. Lack of water can have a severe impact on the health of animals. The facility
must ensure that all animals have access to potable water as often as necessary to ensure their health and well-being.
Corrected at time of inspection on 11-18-2025.
A complete routine inspection was conducted starting on 11-18-2025. This inspection report is limited to the Direct non-
compliances identified during that inspection. An additional inspection report will be delivered with the other issues
identified during this inspection.
This inspection was conducted with the facility representative. The exit briefing was conducted on 11-18-2025 with the
facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
MICHAEL TYGART, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICEREnd Section
